desc: Subdivides a cycle into equal parts for the elements inside the brackets.
Alternates between elements on successive cycles.
Creates a polymetric sequence — elements cycle at their own rate over the parent cycle.
example: "{bd sd cp, hh hh hh hh}"

desc: Distributes n events evenly over k steps using the Euclidean algorithm.
Repeats an element n times within its time slot.
Plays an element once every n cycles.
Randomly removes the event with 50% probability (or a given probability).
Repeats the element n times, each taking its own step (unlike * which subdivides).
Makes an element take up n steps worth of time.
Shorthand for grouping — "bd . sd hh" is equivalent to "[bd] [sd hh]".
Selects a specific sample variant by index from a sample bank.
Extends the previous element into this step (legato/tie).
